chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
The concept that God is the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit is explained like this. The Lord Himself states in the law: "Listen, Israel, the Lord your God is one God." And the Apostle affirms: "There is no God but one."

Similarly, he also declares: "One God, one faith, one baptism." Ephesians Chapter 4. Likewise, the Apostle James states: "You believe that there is one God, you do well; even the demons believe and tremble." James Chapter 2.

The demons tremble at this faith, which they did not want to accept as true. The Lord Himself declares: "I am God, and there is no other besides me." Also, in Psalm 18: "Who is God besides the Lord, or who is God except our God?"

And they themselves acknowledge that the Son is also God. Let them explain how He is one, unless it is because the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit are one.
chunks.original_latin:
Quod unus Deus Pater, et Filius, et Spiritus sanctus,
sic docetur. Ipse Dominus in lege dicit: Audi,
Israel, Dominus Deus tuus Deus unus est. Et Apostolus
dicit: Nullus est Deus, nisi unus. Item ipse dicit:
unus Deus, una fides, unum baptisma (Eph IV). Item
apostolus Jacobus dicit: Tu credis quia unus est Deus,
bene facis; et daemones credunt et contremiscunt (Jac II). Hanc fidem contremiscunt daemones quam veram
esse noluerunt. Ipse Dominus dicit: Ego sum Deus
et non est alius praeter me. Item in psalm. XXVII: Quis
Deus praeter Dominum, aut quis Deus praeter Deum
 nostrum? Et ipsi confitentur quia et Filius Deus est. Ostendant mihi quomodo unus est, nisi quia Pater,
et Filius, et Spiritus sanctus unus est.
